div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-EehZO jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Dear Parents, Students, Staff and Community,

div.p: Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, our schools will be closed in response to the COVID-19 virus. This closure is now scheduled to continue through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Further information regarding the duration of the closure and plans to continue instruction and learning can be found below as we strive to keep you apprised of current information, including new developments and advisories.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

div.p: The safety and well-being of our students, staff and parents is of paramount importance and our district and site administration and our Board of Trustees work diligently to support that commitment. We recognize the critical nature of the current COVID-19 outbreak and our need to protect the well-being of all concerned. We are working with local agencies and school districts daily, sometimes hourly, to ensure that the measures we are taking are appropriate and in alignment with the most up-to-date guidelines. We would also like to share the most current information with which we've been provided regarding how colleges and universities are handling grading in the era of COVID-19: CSU and Higher Education Statement.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: How will the closures impact the school year? Will we have to make up lost days at the end of the school?

span.style: font-family: Open Sans;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Governor’s Executive Order N-26-20 waives the 180 school day and instructional minute requirements for those schools closed due to the COVID-19 outbreak. At this point, we do not anticipate having to make up any instructional time lost due to school closures.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: If a student needs CASSY or other mental health support services, whom can they contact? If you or someone you know are in crisis or in need of immediate support, please call 911 or one of the following 24-hour crisis lines: Text BAY to 741-741 (Crisis Text Line); (855) 278-4204 (Santa Clara); or (800) 273-8255 (National). If support is not needed immediately, students can contact their guidance counselor and they will connect the student to a CASSY therapist. Updated CASSY referral processes are available by clicking here.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Are school campuses and facilities open during the closure?

span.style: font-family: Open Sans;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: ALL campus buildings and facilities are closed. Students may

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: come to campus for any reasons without explicit permission during this closure.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans;
span.strong: LGSUHSD Communications re: COVID-19 & School Closure:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
span.a: April 17/19 Reminder Email to students and parents

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
span.a: April 15, 2020 - Phase 2 Remote Learning Update

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
span.a: April 1, 2020 - School Closure through the end of the 2019-2020 school year

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.a: April 1, 2020 - School Closure through the end of the 2019-2020 school year - MANDARIN TRANSLATION

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
